title: Man, 18, and boys, 16 and 12, are killed and six-year-old is missing after car plunges into canal
text:
Three young people died and a six-year-old child remained missing Sunday night after a car plunged into a canal, police said.

Among the dead was an 18-year-old male driver, who managed to rescue a teenage occupant from the car, before dying himself trying to save others, said Delaware State Police.

Authorities said the search was continuing west of the town of St Georges, Delaware, according to a late Sunday night press release.

Five young occupants were inside a car that plunged into a Delaware canal on Sunday. Three of the occupants died 12 to 18 died, and a 6-year-old boy remained missing, according to police

The driver of the vehicle was praised as a hero for saving the lone survivor of the crash - a 16-year-old girl - before he perished himself trying to save others. The motorist was the first recovered by multiple agencies (pictured above) who responded

The car with the five young occupants plunged into the Chesapeake and Delaware Canal around 9:40 am Sunday.

Delaware State Police said they initially found the body of the 18-year-old male driver in the water after he had helped a 16-year-old girl make it safely to shore.

A police statement said two more passengers, boys ages 12 and 16, were pronounced dead hours later after they were found inside the car when it was hoisted from the water.

The final passenger, a 6-year-old boy, wasn't found and remained unaccounted for late Sunday, according to police.

the Delaware News Journal reports. All of the male occupants are related, and the teenage girl was a friend,

Master Corporal Michael Austin praised the teen driver for saving the 16-year-old survivor and valiantly trying to save others.

'He was a hero,' Austin said Sunday afternoon. 'He tried to do everything he could to help the remaining passengers in that vehicle.'

The driver worked to free the girl, who first responders later found sitting on the banks of the canal after a bystander had called 911, reports the Delaware News Journal.

Crews from multiple law enforcement agencies then worked for hours to remove the car from the canal, pulling it out after 5 p.m. in what was described as a multi-agency recovery operation.

Austin said all five occupants are Delaware residents. None were immediately identified, pending notification of relatives.

The canal is about 35 feet (more than 10 meters) deep, according to the U.S. Army Corps of Engineers.

State police said the situation unfolded about a mile (.6 kilometers) west of a State Route 1 bridge in Delaware.

Police, fire, maritime units and a dive team and paramedics all took part in the effort.

Authorities said a state police collision reconstruction unit is continuing to investigate how the car went into the canal.
description: The car with the five young occupants plunged into the Chesapeake and Delaware Canal, west of St Georges, around 9:40 am Sunday. Three bodies were recovered, while a six-year-old is missing.
